CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The optical properties of these random terpolymers can be easily controlled by tuning the ratio between DPP and TPD ; an increase in TPD induced increased absorption between 400 and 650 nm and a lower highest occupied molecular orbital energy level , while higher DPP contents resulted in stronger absorption between 600 and 900 nm.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| random terpolymers |
| DPP |
| TPD |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| random terpolymers |
| DPP |
| TPD |

(Note: In the original paragraph, "these random terpolymers" refers to the material as a whole, but for the purpose of this exercise, we are looking for specific material names mentioned in the paragraph, so "random terpolymers" is considered a valid material name entity.)

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The optical properties of these random terpolymers can be easily controlled by tuning the ratio between DPP and TPD ; an increase in TPD induced increased absorption between 400 and 650 nm and a lower highest occupied molecular orbital energy level , while higher DPP contents resulted in stronger absorption between 600 and 900 nm.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| optical properties |
| ratio between DPP and TPD |
| absorption (between 400 and 650 nm) |
| absorption (between 600 and 900 nm) |
| highest occupied molecular orbital energy level |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| optical properties |
| absorption (between 400 and 650 nm) |
| absorption (between 600 and 900 nm) |
| highest occupied molecular orbital energy level |

Note: "ratio between DPP and TPD" is not a material property, but rather a composition property, and has been removed from the table.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The optical properties of these random terpolymers can be easily controlled by tuning the ratio between DPP and TPD ; an increase in TPD induced increased absorption between 400 and 650 nm and a lower highest occupied molecular orbital energy level , while higher DPP contents resulted in stronger absorption between 600 and 900 nm.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| optical properties of these random terpolymers |
| ratio between DPP and TPD |
| absorption between 400 and 650 nm |
| highest occupied molecular orbital energy level |
| TPD |
| DPP |

The properties "optical properties of these random terpolymers" is a compound property made up of the properties "absorption between 400 and 650 nm" and "highest occupied molecular orbital energy level". However, for the purpose of this exercise, I will present them separately. The properties "TPD" and "DPP" are entities that can influence the optical properties.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| absorption between 400 and 650 nm |
| highest occupied molecular orbital energy level |

The properties "optical properties of these random terpolymers" and "ratio between DPP and TPD" do not clearly refer to material property values. The properties "TPD" and "DPP" are entities that can influence the material properties.
